result.execSummary:
The defendant Marquis A Brookshire was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Marquis A Brookshire is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Marquis A Brookshire was found guilty of Vehicle Operator Flee/Elude Officer, a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 346.04(3).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
- Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess a firearm. 
- Court advised defendant that he may not vote until his civil rights have been restored.

Concurrent with: Concurrent to case 16CF2792, with credit for 90 DAYS time served.
-Defendant is to provide a DNA sample.

-Pay ALL MANDATORY costs, fees, and surcharges (including DNA) to be paid through collection by the Department of Corrections in an amount or percentage the Department (DOC) determines to be reasonable and as a condition of extended supervision.  DOC shall collect those sums.  Any amount remaining due and owing is subject to civil judgment and/or tax intercept or other means.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Marquis A Brookshire

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Marquis A Brookshire in court, in custody.  Attorney Jade K Hall in court for Marquis A Brookshire.  Attorney Patrick J Anderson in court for State of Wisconsin. 
Case in court for Plea and Sentencing Hearing. Parties have reached a resolution. State placed negotiations on the record. Defense counsel and defendant confirms. 

AS TO COUNT 3: Defendant was advised of constitution rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights and entered a plea of GUILTY.  Defendant examined as to the plea.  Stipulation by parties to complaint as a factual basis to sustain the guilty plea. Defendant advised that if not a United States Citizen, deportation is possible.  Court found that defendant knowingly, voluntarily and intelligently waived his/her rights.  Court found defendant guilty and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record. 

Sentencing hearing proceeded. Statements by State, Defense Counsel, and Defendant.

AS TO COUNT 3:
Court ordered Defendant to serve 6 MONTHS in the House of Correction, CONCURRENT to case 16CF2792, with credit for 90 DAYS time served.

-Pay ALL MANDATORY costs, fees, and surcharges (including DNA) to be paid through collection by the Department of Corrections in an amount or percentage the Department (DOC) determines to be reasonable and as a condition of extended supervision.  DOC shall collect those sums.  Any amount remaining due and owing is subject to civil judgment and/or tax intercept or other means.
-Defendant is to provide a DNA sample.

Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess a firearm. 
Court advised defendant that he may not vote until his civil rights have been restored.  
Court advised defendant of his right to seek postconviction relief, 20 day appeal rights given

Filed: 
Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief
Pretrial Incarceration Credit
Ineligible Voting Notice and Acknowledgement

Defendant Marquis A Brookshire in court, in custody.  Attorney Jade K Hall in court for Marquis A Brookshire.  Attorney Patrick J Anderson in court for State of Wisconsin. 
Case in court for a final pretrial. Upon motion of State, Court ordered Counts 1 and 2 dismissed without prejudice. Parties ready to proceed to trial on Count 3. After discussions on the record, case is in resolution posture. Court takes a recess to return at 1:30pm for a plea hearing.
Plea hearing scheduled for September 23, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights, Addendum to Plea and Elements/Jury Instruction, filed.
Filed: Original Transcript of PRELIMINARY HEARING (21 pages) commencing 04-29-2022 by Danielle N. Holcomb.
All previously ordered bail condition remain as previously ordered.

Attorney Jade K Hall in court, defendant Marquis A Brookshire not in court, in custody.  Patrick J Anderson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  State motion to adjourn for reasons stated on the record.  Case is set for speedy jury trial this day.  State informed the court that defendant has pending federal charges.    Case adjourned for final pretrial and for jury trial in Branch 25.   All parties are notified that effective July 30, 2022 this case will be assigned to Judge David Swanson, Branch 11, in Room 316 of the Safety Building.
*
Bail hearing proceeded.  Statements heard.  Court set signature bond at $1000.00  Final pre-trial scheduled for September 23, 2022 at 09:00 am.  Jury trial scheduled for November 7, 2022 at 09:00 am.

Attorney Jade K Hall in court, defendant Marquis A Brookshire not in court, in custody.  Patrick J Anderson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defense has filed a demand for speedy trial that expires on 8/15/2022.   Case adjourned for jury trial in Branch 25.  Any defense motions to be filed by 6/30/2022.  Jury trial scheduled for July 11, 2022 at 09:00 am.
Defendant's Constitutional And Statutory Demand For Speedy Trial - received    (expires August 17, 2022)
Bail motion by defense argued and denied by the Court.

Defendant Marquis A Brookshire in court with Attorney Jade K Hall.  Defendant Marquis A Brookshire in custody.  John Daniel Flynn appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  PARTIES APPEAR BY VIDEO.
Preliminary hearing proceeded.  Sworn for the State: MPD Detective M. Martin. State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original information received and filed;  defendant given a copy, waived reading, was arraigned in open court and plead not guilty.  Case is adjourned to Branch 28.  Scheduling conference scheduled for June 15, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Court ordered no contact with T.V.H
No Contact/No Weapons Order, signed and filed.
Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION Level 5.  No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.

Defendant Marquis A Brookshire in court with attorney Colleen A Taylor as to firend of the court.  Defendant advised of right to counsel.  Court examined defendant as to his waiver of counsel.  Court finds defendant freely and voluntarily waives his right to counsel. Defendant Marquis A Brookshire in custody.  Dax Odom appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Sanders, Branch 28. Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.    Commissioner advised DNA sample has been obtained from the Defendant.  Court advised Defendant he may qualify to have the DNA sample data expunged if he meets the conditions under Wisconsin Statutes Section 165.77(4). DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.
This hearing will be streamed live on Dacast:  https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/99073afd-37c2-acfa-830d-b1ddcaebf0ea
  Preliminary hearing scheduled for April 29, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
